Package com.knockk.api.controller

Class ResidentController

java.lang.Object
com.knockk.api.controller.ResidentController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/residents") public class ResidentController extends Object
This class is the rest controller the admin application consumes
Author:
graceradlund

  • Method Details

    • updateFriendship

      @PostMapping("/friendship") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateFriendship(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid FriendshipModel friendshipRequest, org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
      Creates a friendship between two residents, by resident id and neighbor's resident id. Used when a resident makes a request to connect with their neighbor. Defaults accepted to false.
      Parameters:
      friendshipRequest - : model used in the request
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • createAccount

      @PostMapping("/create-account") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createAccount(@RequestBody UserModel credentials, org.springframework.validation.Errors errors) throws Exception
      Creates a user account. Used to register the email and password.
      Parameters:
      credentials - : of the resident
      errors - : if there are validation errors
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getLease

      @GetMapping("/lease") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getLease(@RequestParam(name="address") String address, @RequestParam(name="buildingName") String name, @RequestParam(name="floor") int floor, @RequestParam(name="room") int room, @RequestParam(name="startDate") String startDate, @RequestParam(name="endDate") String endDate)
      Shows the details of a lease, by building, floor, room, start date, and end date. Used when a resident is registering to tie them to a lease. Uses query params because we are filtering the database to see if this lease exists.
      Parameters:
      address - : the address the resident lives in
      name - : the name of the building the resident lives in
      floor - : the floor the resident lives on
      room - : the room the resident lives in
      startDate - : when the resident's lease starts
      endDate - : when the resident's lease ends
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • getFriendship

      @GetMapping("/{residentId}/friendship/{friendId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getFriendship(@PathVariable("residentId") String id, @PathVariable("friendId") String friendId)
      Shows details of a friendship, by resident id and friend's resident id. Used to see if the resident is connected with the neighbor (to see if it's pending). A friendship that doesn't exist will throw a 404 error. NOTE: Should ensure that the friend is a neighbor of the resident. May not be necessary because viewing a room fetches if there is a friendship or not.
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident
      friendId - : if of the neighboring resident
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • deleteFriendship

      @DeleteMapping("/{residentId}/friendship/{friendId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteFriendship(@PathVariable("residentId") String id, @PathVariable("friendId") String friendId)
      Removes a friendship, by resident id and freind's resident id. Used when a resident unconnects with a friend.
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident trying to remove the friendship
      friendId - : id of the friend the resident no longer wants to be friends with
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • getBuilding

      @GetMapping("/building/{street}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getBuilding(@PathVariable("street") String street)
      Shows building details, by building name. Used upon resident registering. This ensures that they live in a building that is in the database.
      Parameters:
      street - : street of the building
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • getNeighborResidents

      @GetMapping("/{residentId}/neighbor-units/{floor}-{room}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getNeighborResidents(@PathVariable("residentId") String id, @PathVariable("floor") int floor, @PathVariable("room") int room)
      Retrieve a list of residents in a neighboring unit TODO: make sure params are valid. make sure they are acutally neighbors? do something with the id
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident (user)
      floor - : floor that the neighboring unit is on
      room - : room that the neighboring unit is
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • getNeighborUnits

      @GetMapping("/{residentId}/neighbor-units") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getNeighborUnits(@PathVariable("residentId") String id)
      Retrieve neighboring rooms (getResidentResidentIdNeighboringRooms) Shows details of rooms that the resident is neighbors with, by resident id. Used when a resident is at the root page. Will display all directions the resident has a neighbor. For example, if there is no neighbor above, there will be arrows point to the right, down, and left - but not up.
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident making the request
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • getResident

      @GetMapping("/{residentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getResident(@PathVariable("residentId") String id)
      Show details of a resident, by resident id. Used when displaying the resident profile, or when viewing a connected neighbor. Not necessary for displaying an unconnected neighbor because that only displays their name, which is fetched in the /residents/{residentId}/neighbor-rooms/{unit-id} call.
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • updateResident

      @PostMapping("/{residentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateResident(@PathVariable("residentId") String id, @RequestBody OptionalResidentModel residentInfo)
      Update a resident, by resident id. Only voluntary information upon registration can be updated. Used when the resident wants to update their profile. Resident should not be able to update their name, gender, or information pertaining to their lease. Resident should only be able to update their own profile.
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the resident
      residentInfo - : model sent in the request that has optional fields the resident can update
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> login(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserModel credentials, org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
      Logs the user in Used when the resident logs in to the app. Verifies the credentials in the database. Important to note that the password will be hashed.
      Parameters:
      credentials - : credentials passed by the admin in the request
      errors - : data-binding and validation errors relating to the request body
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

    • register

      @PostMapping("/") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> register(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RegisterModel registerInfo, org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
      Log the resident in. Used when the resident logs in to the app. Verifies the credentials in the database. Important to note that the password will be hashed.
      Parameters:
      registerInfo - : information about the resident being registered
      errors - : data-binding and validation errors relating to the request body
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code, message, and data

      Method to handle the responses of errors
      Parameters:
      e - : error that occured
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a status code message, and data
